text: On tap at 1000 Beers. Dark violet, blackberry aroma, medium body, and taste is rich blackberry.  World class cider.
On tap and from a growler. Pours a deep purple. Aromas of blackberries and fresh cut apples. Taste is fairly sweet but very fruity. Great stuff.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2017 Pours a deep dark purple. Somewhat sweet with a nice blackberry flavor like a light syrup. OK but not great. Better than I originally thought. Like drinking blackberry jelly with a nice warm finish. 9 Feb 2017 increased rating from 3.0 to 3.5
Dark purple. Looks interesting like purple drank. Smells nice. Like a grape juice Sunday. Juicy. Sweet. Very cloying with a tart wine barrel finish. I cant tell if I like it or love it.
Bottle. Purple pour with white head. Blackberry jam, fruit and sweet aromas. Super sweet, blackberries and ham like notes.
RBSG 2016. On tap @ Urban Tap House. Deep violet hue. Unctuous, deep, intense berry flavour, sticky sweet but with a touch of acid and appleskin. Sublime.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Draft - pours dark purple - nose/taste of rich dark blackberry, apple and vinous notes - medium body
Draft pour. The cider is a deep purple with a fizzy pink head. Aroma has funky fruity blackberries. Tart and fruity taste. Delicious.

On tap at Caliente. Pours a very dark purple with small off white head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is strong blackberry and red wine. Medium body, grape juice, vinous, light dry finish, really enjoyed this.
Draft - Blackberry intense and concentrated. Deep purple. Intense blackberry and a light sweet and tartness. Marvellous.
Sampled at Caliente. Very dark looking and opaque. Big blackberry everything. Fairly sour and a bit funky. I like it.
Draft at Caliente. Dark royal putple color. Nice aroma of berries, apple, funk. Sweet berry taste up front then fruity funk, quick finish. Delicious.

Draft at Arsenal Cider House in Pittsburgh. The sign says semi-sweet and thats exactly right. For a cider this is pretty good, not too sweet, dry and simple without any excess. High priced at $8 for a small plastic glass but I guess thats the norm these inflationary days.

Sampled on draft at Hou Thou this beer poured a black color with a trace white head that faded quickly and left no lacing. The aroma was strong with sweet and tart blackberry. The flavor was sweet, tangy and tart with crisp notes of blackberry and raspberry. Long finish. Moderately full bodied. Excellent.
